name: STEM Education Works
description: STEM Education Works has developed authentic, industry-aligned learning experiences to cultivate the technical competencies and employability skills necessary for student success within regional workforce ecosystems. With our standards-aligned STEM curriculum, we provide integrative science and mathematics concepts into design-based learning engineering practices, which enables all educators to teach vital competencies in programming, robotics, automation, electronics, logistics, supply chain management, engineering design, and innovation.

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: Early Workforce Development Program Manager at Endress+Hauser USA
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
Another great group of seventy-five 6th graders today visiting the E+H Design & Innovation Studio learning about Dobot robotics, Spheros Bolts, 3D Design and printing, Micro:bit coding, Lego challenge and even industrial flow and level measurement technologies at the PTU Challenge.  These STEM experiences showing the students how fun and cool science can be.  Again this would not be possible without the great partnership and support from STEM Education Works  Purdue IN-MaC   As well as tremendous volunteer support from our talented group of our Rotational Engineer/Business professionals here at E+H.

#STEM
#innovationstudio
#workforcedevelopment

company_updates_collection.description:
Will a $60K starting salary be enough to solve the teacher shortage? Teacher vacancies are at an all time high and continuing to grow just as our children need them the most as they try to recover from the learning loss incurred since early 2020.

#teachersmatter #learningloss #educationforall
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: President at STEM Education Works
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
In 2022, EducationWeek estimated that more than 36,500 teacher vacancies exist in the United States. They also noted that uncredentialed teachers filled more than 163,500 positions. Meanwhile, the Teacher Salary Project pointed out that 74% of teachers don’t believe they receive fair pay. Teacher shortages are among the top threat to access to quality education. 

The American Teacher Act would incentivize states to raise their minimum teacher salaries to $60,000 for public K-12 schools through a grant program at the Department of Education. The legislation would also mandate yearly increases congruent to inflation to support states' ongoing efforts to ensure competitive wages.
#education #access #qualityeducationforall #teachersmatter 
https://lnkd.in/gzxqhMZM

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: Purdue University, IN-MaC Director of Education & Workforce, Ph.D. Candidate
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description: Did you know that the Purdue IN-MaC Design and Innovation Studio model not only provides early access to students in K-8 to Industry 4.0 technologies in formal dedicated learning environments but we also provide professional development by upskilling educators in all things technology related with our partners at STEM Education Works. Teamwork makes the dream work. #inmac #studios #stemeducationworks #littleBits #upskilling #teachers #technology #education #teamwork #purdueuniversity

company_updates_collection.description:
We cheer on Endress+Hauser Group as they continue their dedication to invest in and inspire the workforce of tomorrow. We are thrilled to support their community outreach efforts in partnership with Purdue IN-MaC as they even the playing field and give opportunities for all students in their community to participate in early workforce development through access to hands-on STEM learning experiences. Dobot Robotics. Sindoh. Micro:bit Educational Foundation. Sphero. 
#robotics #opportunities #earlyaccess #workforcedevelopment #community
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: Early Workforce Development Program Manager at Endress+Hauser USA
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description: A flurry of STEM learning this week, at a local Elementary Science Fair with Sphero Indi cars, STEM HS class with 3D design & printing, Intermediate School visitors in our Studio with PTU Challenge, Sphero BOLTS, Micro:bit coding, Dobot robots, and Saturday attending the Pacers STEM FEST at Gainbridge Fieldhouse. Thanks to our partners at Purdue IN-MaC STEM Education Works and all the wonderful E+H associates contributing to our community outreach for Early Workforce Development.   #STEM #workforcedevelopment #Innovation

Saturday was #AstronomyDay, and we wanted to be sure to highlight the universe and the incredible discoveries made by #NASA's James Webb Space Telescope were celebrated. 

This stunning image was captured by the Near-Infrared Camera (NIRCam) on Webb, which unveils the previously obscured areas of star birth in NGC 3324, a young, star-forming region in the Carina Nebula. The image shows the "Cosmic Cliffs," the edge of a gigantic, gaseous cavity within NGC 3324, carved by the intense ultraviolet radiation and stellar winds from extremely massive, hot, young stars. 

NIRCam's crisp resolution and unparalleled sensitivity unveil hundreds of previously hidden stars and even numerous background galaxies. This rare event of early star formation is difficult to capture, but Webb has chronicled it with extreme sensitivity and exquisite spatial resolution. 

Read more about Astronomy Day in our latest newsletter at the link below: 

https://lnkd.in/gJQC74Tv

Diving into a world of wonders on World Ocean Day! Join us as we celebrate the beauty, mystery, and importance of our oceans. Together, let's protect and preserve our oceans for generations to come!
#WorldOceanDay #STEM #STEMEducation #MakeTimeForSTEM

"Are we alone in the universe? Well, not sure if you knew this, but just recently we received an alien message from Mars! Well, kinda.

On June 1st, the European Space Agency and SETI teamed up to conduct an experiment to see just how prepared we Earthlings are if we were to ever receive an alien message from outer space one day – a sort of “fire drill” to prepare for the real thing. This mock alien signal was sent from the ExoMars Trace Gas Orbiter, a spacecraft sent to Mars in 2016 by the ESA to orbit and study the Martian atmosphere. After traveling through space for 16 minutes, the signal was detected here on Earth by the Allen Telescope Array in Northern California, the Green Bank Telescope in West Virginia, and the Medicina Radio Astronomical Station near Bologna, Italy. In an effort to raise public interest and involvement, the data was released publicly on the internet to see who could decipher its contents first. Groups of internet sleuths are still hard at work separating the signal from background noise and decoding the meaning of the message.

This project, called “A Sign in Space,” not only serves as a great way to test our ability to intercept and interpret a message from an alien civilization in the future, but it also proves that such an endeavor would truly be a global, collaborative effort if the real thing were to ever occur. Let’s cross our fingers. Or tentacles. Whatever."

- Dr. Jake Roark, STEM Education Works Curriculum and Outreach Specialist

https://lnkd.in/gfptRHdw

We had the opportunity to witness The Cummins Design and Innovation Studio gain partnership with Purdue IN-MaC! 

Purdue IN-MaC and STEM Education Works offers knowledge in developing student curricula that seamlessly with the state-of-the-art equipment available in the studios.

You heard it here first. Cummins Inc. has recently launched the Cummins READY initiative, which aims to empower at least one million learners and workers globally by 2030. This initiative will be supported by investments in local and global education partnerships to help pre-K through post-secondary and workforce training.

Vincennes University proudly hosted the grand opening of the VU Design and Innovation Training Studio in the Summers Center on the VU Campus on Tuesday, July 23. The training studio, developed with funding from the Lilly Endowment Inc. through its Charting the Future Initiative, is a significant step in further enhancing access to high-quality Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) education in #Indiana.
 
It is part of VU's ongoing efforts to establish a Design and Innovation Studios network in elementary and middle schools throughout Southwest Indiana. Partners in this statewide project include K-12 schools, Purdue IN-MaC, and #Toyota Motor Manufacturing, Indiana, Inc. (TMMI).

Thank you to Chuck Johnson, Stephanie Stemle, Cynthia Ragle, and Angela Dougherty and STEM Education Works  for this continued partnership and commitment to STEM access.

Exciting developments are underway, and I feel incredibly fortunate to lead the Madison Avenue Clubhouse within an organization so well-positioned for growth and impact. It’s both a privilege and a responsibility to guide my team through this dynamic period, to drive positive change and accomplish our shared goals.

On Thursday, October 17th, we hosted a ribbon-cutting ceremony to mark the opening of the ASML STEM Lab & Makerspace at the Madison Avenue Community Clubhouse! This collaboration between ASML and Wakeman Boys & Girls Club supports our mission to help young people achieve positive outcomes in academic success and life & workforce readiness.

Funded through a grant from ASML, we will use the funds to equip the Lab with all necessary materials and supplies; to provide the staff members with STEM-related professional development provided by our partners at STEM Education Works; and to send students on STEM-focused field trips. As part of the company’s support, ASML employees have committed to volunteering at the site.

If gravity disappeared for a day, would you float away forever?

Jake’s vote for the one law of physics we should never touch? Gravity. And honestly … fair.

From weighted shoes to planetary panic, the conversation takes a wild turn – because when you ask us “what if?”, the answers go orbital.

What law of physics would YOU break for 24 hours if you could?

Lose inertia for a day, and suddenly, we’ll slide into chaos.

Imagine chairs that won’t hold you up. Books that don’t stay put. And cars that STOP the moment you take your foot off the gas.

Is it terrifying? Yes.
Is it hilarious to think about? Also yes.

Check out the full episode for a wild thought experiment and let us know what YOU think would happen if the universe got a physics rewrite.
